name: paper production, woodfree, uncoated, at integrated mill | paper, woodfree, uncoated | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10921/documentation

This dataset represents the production of uncoated woodfree paper (office paper) in an integrated paper mill.

The activity starts at the reception of pulpwood.

The activity ends with packaged paper sheets ready for shipping. 
The dataset includes wood handling, chemical (kraft) pulping and bleaching, paper production, on-site energy production, recovery cycles of chemicals, internal waste water treatment, packaging energy consumption and industrial landfill.
The dataset doesn't include packaging materials and on-site pick-up truck operation, which uses petrol (negligible).

The data originate from a paper mill which produces different types of woodfree papers and kraft pulp. The allocation of most materials and energy inputs between the different coproducts was avoided by subdividing the process of paper making into many subprocesses and collecting data specifically for those subprocesses. However, it was inevitable to make allocation for some general inputs, e.g. diesel burned in on-site vehicles. In those cases, the allocation was done with the dry mass content of the coproducts.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from an important fine paper producer in the province of Quebec, Canada.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Kraft process with elementary chlorine free bleach.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collected from internal reports of the paper mill.

flow.name: paper, woodfree, uncoated
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

exchanges.description:
Reported as dry mass including bark. A density of 450 kg/m3 and a bark volume fraction of 10% were assumed. The species composing the total pulpwood input (excluding wood chips) are (mass %):

Hardwoods (97%):
Maple 37%
Beech 7%
Yellow birch 16%
White birch 11%
Aspen 13%
Other hardwoods 13%

Softwoods (3%):
Eastern hemlock 0.6%
Larch 0.45%
Spruce (White) 0.855%
Balsam Fir 1.05%
White and red pine 0.045%

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Reported as dry mass including bark. A density of 650 kg/m3 and a bark volume fraction of 12% were assumed. The species composing the total pulpwood input (excluding wood chips) are (mass %):

Hardwoods (97%):
Maple 37%
Beech 7%
Yellow birch 16%
White birch 11%
Aspen 13%
Other hardwoods 13%

Softwoods (3%):
Eastern hemlock 0.6%
Larch 0.45%
Spruce (White) 0.855%
Balsam Fir 1.05%
White and red pine 0.045%

The estimated wood density of hardwoods calculated with the above percentages and generic densities specific to each species is very close to 650 kg/m3 (645 kg/m3), including aspen, which has a low density.
